intro: Elatostema procridifolium, commonly known as the small-leaf elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Elatostemaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its compact size and unique leaf morphology, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
